text: Shoucheng Zhang (; February 15, 1963 â€“ December 1, 2018) was a Chinese-born American physicist. He was born in Shanghai. He was the JG Jackson and CJ Wood professor of physics at Stanford University. He was a condensed matter theorist known for his work on topological insulators, the quantum Hall effect, the quantum spin Hall effect, spintronics, and high temperature superconductivity. From 2015 until his death in 2018, Zhang was a member of the National Academy of Sciences. Zhang, who suffered from depression, was found dead at his Stanford, California home on December 1, 2018, aged 55. ==References== ==Other websites== * Web page at Stanford * Group web site at Stanford * Talk at Google about AI and blockchain Category:1963 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American physicists Category:Chinese physicists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Scientists from Shanghai Category:Scientists from California
title: Shoucheng Zhang
